intro: Atalanta serrulata, commonly known as the serrated antler plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
